questions.question: Which ocean surrounds New Zealand?
questions.explanation: New Zealand is located in the South Pacific Ocean.

questions.question: What is the speed of light in a vacuum?
questions.explanation: The speed of light in a vacuum is exactly 299,792,458 meters per second.

questions.question: Who was the first Prime Minister of New Zealand?
questions.explanation: Henry Sewell served as New Zealand's first Premier (later called Prime Minister) in 1856.

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars appears red due to iron oxide (rust) on its surface.

questions.question: What is the capital of New Zealand?
questions.explanation: Wellington has been New Zealand's capital since 1865.

questions.question: What is the largest mammal in the world?
questions.explanation: Blue whales can grow up to 30 meters long and weigh up to 200 tonnes.

questions.question: In which year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with Japan's surrender in September.

questions.question: How many bones are in an adult human body?
questions.explanation: An adult human skeleton has 206 bones, though babies are born with about 270.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
questions.explanation: Au comes from the Latin word 'aurum' meaning gold.

questions.question: What is the largest desert in the world?
questions.explanation: Antarctica is technically the world's largest desert as it receives very little precipitation.

questions.question: Which ancient wonder of the world was located in Alexandria?
questions.explanation: The Lighthouse of Alexandria was one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
